alert.note: Alert for Herkimer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 04 at 2:19PM EDT until August 04 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of eastern New York, including the following counties, Fulton, Herkimer and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 219 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ilion, Herkimer, Little Falls, Mohawk, Frankfort, Dolgeville, Jordanville, Oppenheim, Elizabethtown, Jacksonburg, Fort Herkimer, East Herkimer, Edicks, Wrights Corners, Paines Hollow, Days Rock, Deck, Fink Basin, Smith Corners and Newville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
